data.Sentence_cn: 我第3次接受驾驶执照考试。
data.Sentence: I was being tested for a driving licence for the third time.

data.Sentence_cn: 按照要求在车辆拥挤的路上驾驶，我圆满地完成了。
data.Sentence: I had been asked to drive in heavy traffic and had done so successfully.

data.Sentence_cn: 在接到把车开出城的指令后，我开始有了信心。
data.Sentence: After having been instructed to drive out of town, I began to acquire confidence.

data.Sentence_cn: 确信我已通过考试，所以我几乎开始喜欢起这次考试。
data.Sentence: Sure that I had passed, I was almost beginning to enjoy my test.

data.Sentence_cn: 主考人对我的驾驶想必是满意的，因为他微笑着说：
data.Sentence: The examiner must have been pleased with my performance, for he smiled and said,

data.Sentence_cn: 让我们假设一个小孩子突然在你前面穿过马路。
data.Sentence: Let us suppose that a child suddenly crosses the road in front of you.

data.Sentence_cn: 我一敲车窗，你必须把车停在5英尺之内。”
data.Sentence: As soon as I tap on the window, you must stop within five feet.'

data.Sentence_cn: 我继续往前开着。过了一会儿，主考人砰砰地敲了起来。
data.Sentence: I continued driving and after some time, the examiner tapped loudly.

data.Sentence_cn: 虽然声音听得很清楚，但我过了好一会儿才作出反应。
data.Sentence: Though the sound could be heard clearly, it took me a long time to react.

data.Sentence_cn: 我突然用力踩紧刹车踏板，结果我俩的身体都向前冲去。
data.Sentence: I suddenly pressed the brake pedal hard and we were both thrown forward.
The examiner looked at me sadly.

data.Sentence_cn: “埃姆斯先生，”他以悲伤的声调说，“你刚刚把那个小孩压死了！”
data.Sentence: 'Mr.Eames,' he said, in a mournful voice, 'you have just killed that child!'
